com.github.seqware.queryengine.model
Interface QueryInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
HBasePersistentBackEnd, MRHBasePersistentBackEnd, SimplePersistentBackEnd
public interface QueryInterface

This interface allows users to access queries that are built into the query engine, as well as install/un-install plug-ins that allow the user to perform additional annotation and/or other operations (in other words, this handles the R operations from CRUD)). This interface also specifies the semantics and types of things we need to consider when creating an API to support asynchronous queries. The idea is that FeatureSet results are guaranteed to last a minimum number of hours after which we make no guarantees. Parameter can be set to less than zero for permanent creation. This interface specifies all queries that are intrinsic (i.e. built into the query engine). While they share a similar structure to plug-ins which can be installed, parts of the back-end will call these so it does not make sense to install/un-install them.

Version:
$Id: $Id
Author:
jbaran, dyuen

getFeaturesByPlugin

<ReturnValue> QueryFuture<ReturnValue> getFeaturesByPlugin(int hours,
                                                           Class<? extends AnalysisPluginInterface> pluginClass,
                                                           FeatureSet set,
                                                           Object... parameters)
Call an arbitrary installed plug-in by class and initiate it

Type Parameters:
ReturnValue - a ReturnValue object.
Parameters:
hours - minimum time to live
pluginClass - plug-in class to use
parameters - parameters to use when initializing the plug-in
set - a FeatureSet object.
Returns:
null if there is an error, QueryFuture if the plug-in is successfully run

getFeaturesByAttributes

QueryFuture<FeatureSet> getFeaturesByAttributes(int hours,
                                                FeatureSet set,
                                                RPNStack constraints)
Filter features by a range of attributes.

Parameters:
hours - minimum time to live
set - parent FeatureSet, can be null if we want to query over the entire back-end
constraints - A stack of concrete values (constants), parameters and operations that are used to set query constraints.
Returns:
featureSet with features filtered by type

getFeatures

QueryFuture<FeatureSet> getFeatures(int hours,
                                    FeatureSet set)
(Do not) filter features

Parameters:
hours - minimum time to live
set - parent FeatureSet
Returns:
featureSet with features not filtered

getFeaturesByRange

QueryFuture<FeatureSet> getFeaturesByRange(int hours,
                                           FeatureSet set,
                                           QueryInterface.Location location,
                                           String structure,
                                           long start,
                                           long stop)
filter features that overlap with a given range

Parameters:
hours - minimum time to live
set - parent FeatureSet
location - specify type of location query
structure - chromosome, scaffold, etc
start - start co-ordinate inclusive
stop - end co-ordinate inclusive
Returns:
featureSet with features filtered by location/range

getFeaturesByTag

QueryFuture<FeatureSet> getFeaturesByTag(int hours,
                                         FeatureSet set,
                                         String subject,
                                         String predicate,
                                         String object)
filter features with tags.

Parameters:
hours - minimum time to live
set - parent feature set
subject - tag subject (always required)
predicate - may be null to get Tags with all predicates
object - may be null to get Tags with all (or no) objects
Returns:
featureSet with features filtered by tags

Parameters:
hours - a int.
set - a FeatureSet object.
Returns:
a QueryFuture object.
